alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued March 30 at 8:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR FINE PARTICULATES FROM 400 PM THURSDAY UNTIL 900 AM FRIDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Fine Particulates. WHERE...El Paso and Elbert Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Simla, Matheson, and surrounding areas. WHEN...400 PM Thursday March 30 to 900 AM Friday March 31 IMPACTS...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke Issued for northeastern El Paso and Elbert Counties Issued at 4:15 PM MDT, Thursday, March 30, 2023 Issued by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment Affected Area: northeastern El Paso and Elbert Counties, including, but not limited to Simla, Matheson, and surrounding areas. Advisory in Effect: 4:15 PM MDT, Thursday, March 30, 2023 to 9:00 AM MDT, Friday, March 31, 2023. Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy. Outlook: A fire in northeastern El Paso County ignited on Thursday. Strong, gusty winds from the southwest are expected to continue this afternoon, and smoke is possible in locations northeast of the fire. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
